intro: Bilabrella linderi, commonly known as the Linder's bilabrella, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
